edu.uw.cs.cse461.util

Interface ConfigManagerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConfigManager

    public interface ConfigManagerInterface
    The public interface for the ConfigManager class, which provides a minimal wrapper extending java.util.Properties (so public methods of that class may be used as well as the ones listed here). The primary functions are to introduce int values (rather than just strings), to perform some validty checking on those values, and to mask the exceptions thrown by java.util.Properties when you ask for the value of a key that doesn't exist. Those exceptions are replaced by logging a warning and returning a caller-supplied default value.

    Note: Like other interfaces in this project, this interface definition is provided for documentation reasons - it's a succinct listing of the public methods. It is not intended that there ever be more than one implementation of this interface.

    Author:
    zahorjan

      String[] getAsStringVec(String key)
      Converts the value associated with the key from a space separated list of strings to an array of String (e.g., "a.b c.d e f.g.h" to ["a.b", "c.d", "e", "f.g.h"]).
      ArrayList<String[]> readNameIPPortVec(String fieldName)
      Reads vectors of entries like x.submit.test.cse461.:IP:port
      ArrayList<String[]> readNamePasswordVec(String fieldName)
      Reads whitespace separated vectors of entries like jz.cse461.:password
      ArrayList<String[]> readNameRecordVec(String fieldName)
      Reads field values that are whitespace separated vectors of entries that are colon separated lists of strings, like a:jz.cse461.:password and cname:jz.cse461:foo.cse461:password.

    • Method Detail

      • getAsStringVec

        String[] getAsStringVec(String key)
        Converts the value associated with the key from a space separated list of strings to an array of String (e.g., "a.b c.d e f.g.h" to ["a.b", "c.d", "e", "f.g.h"]).

      • getAsInt

        int getAsInt(String key)
             throws NoSuchFieldException
        Return the integer value associated with the key argument. Throws an exception if the key doesn't exist in the config file.
        Throws:
        NoSuchFieldException

      • getAsInt

        int getAsInt(String key,
           int defaultVal)
        Returns the integer value associated with the key argument. Returns defaultVal if the key doesn't exist in the config file.

      • getAsInt

        int getAsInt(String key,
           int defaultVal,
           int minimum)
        Returns the integer value associated with the key argument. Returns defaultVal if the key doesn't exist in the config file. Adds a warning message to the log if the returned value is less than minimum.

      • getAsInt

        int getAsInt(String key,
           int defaultVal,
           int minimum,
           int maximum)
        Returns the integer value associated with the key argument. Returns defaultVal if the key doesn't exist in the config file. Adds a warning message to the log if the returned value is less than minimum or greater than maximum.

      • readNameRecordVec

        ArrayList<String[]> readNameRecordVec(String fieldName)
                                      throws RuntimeException
        Reads field values that are whitespace separated vectors of entries that are colon separated lists of strings, like a:jz.cse461.:password and cname:jz.cse461:foo.cse461:password.
        Parameters:
        fieldName -
        Returns:
        Vectory of String arrays, each entry of which is simply a split input entry.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - Entries should have 3 values unless the first elemente in 'cname', in which case they should have 4 entries.
